title.narrative: Bringing the CAK funding, staffing and governance structure to a professional and sustainable level

description.narrative:
Action plan The action plan differentiates a short-term and a long-term plan. To come to the proper functioning of CAK on long term, Agriterra offers her knowledge to CAK in its already planned process of changes. The long-term aim is the primary agricultural cooperatives to give support in all facets of the relevance of the connected farmers promotion and improvement. Positions of CAK and Agriterra • CAK is the executing party in this reorganization • Agriterra monitors the developments • Agriterra brings in knowledge • Agriterra acts as an adviser
Short-term plan 1. Make a realistic budget for 2018. How much money is needed to CAK, to grow from its current position to a new position that makes her end 2018 ready the re-newed organization and staff can fulfil the desired tasks. (e.g. number of staff members, ICT-systems, office facilities). 2. Calculate the needed subscription fee pro member based on the budget. 3. Prepare a governance structure for complying with an independent position, but members influence must be guaranteed. An independent Supervisory Board is a prerequisite. Realize involvement of board members, involvement of women and involvement of younger people. 4. These steps must be approved by Board and General Assembly as soon as possible. 5. Realize these steps in 2018. Long-term perspective CAK becomes the most excellent and therefore unavoidable influencer in Kenya’s cooperative movement. The voice of the cooperatives. This should be CAK’s focus, next to organize cooperative platforms on county and regional levels.
Short-term goal:
CAK is well funded, well-staffed and its governance structure is an example for all cooperatives in Kenya (and abroad), by: * Make a realistic budget for 2018. How much money is needed to CAK, to grow from its current position to a new position that makes her end 2018 ready the renewed organization and staff can fulfil the desired tasks. (e.g. number of staff members, ICT-systems, office facilities). * Calculate the needed subscription fee pro member based on the budget. * Prepare a governance structure for complying with an independent position, but members influence must be guaranteed. * An independent Supervisory Board is a prerequisite. * Realize involvement of board members, involvement of women and involvement of younger people. * These steps must be approved by Board and General Assembly as soon as possible. * Realize these steps in 2018.. Long-term perspectiveCAK becomes the most excellent and therefore unavoidable influencer in Kenya’s cooperative movement. It is the voice of the cooperatives. This should be CAK’s focus, next to organize cooperative platforms on county and regional levels.
